title: ABSDBS-8" ver. 0.71b
license: Creative Commons - Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike

description.text:
My 200/1000 newton telescope from ABS which weights only 5,5kg
a regular 200x200mm printer is sufficient for the OTA and mount.
https://youtu.be/rU0g6_gWuTk

Construction designed for the HC-1 focuser which weights only 62grams and don't jamming in the cold which frequently occurs for the threaded helix focusers. (may be used another focuser but this requeres focuser-platform redesign)

the list and the number of printed items in a text file

Also this construction requires a bunch of bolts and nuts, M4 and M5, three good and hard springs (with diameter of M5 bolts), 8 aluminum tubes of diameter 12 mm
and length of ~870mm*, 6 bearings with diameter 16mm bore 5mm, spider with secondary mirror , main mirror, focuser.

https://youtu.be/r6JPN2v9uLg
https://youtu.be/1REHZZvOI_0 Assembly absdbs-8" =)

fb: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100003787244126
vk: https://vk.com/homemadedob

In the comments ask a question what kind of mirror will do. Only parabolic not spherical, on Ali Express often sell spherical mirror , it is necessary to clarify this point
I'm not very well versed in trading platforms but I think on eBay you can buy the right mirror =)
I just did - I bought a used tube Newtonian without a mount (OTA) and took out of it :)
I have a set of 203mm primary mirror with a focal length of 1000mm and the secondary mirror 52mm small axis. You can take the 200mm mirror with a large (or smaller) focal length, this will require to add a length of pipe and add another counterweight. The size of the required secondary mirror can count "calculator telescope Newton" or that it is easier to ask there where you will take a main mirror which is secondary to his suit.
Also on this site there are many variants of pointer holders, focuser and other details. I'll try to print them out and add in the description links to them =) why make a new version of what already is there.
My text can be write errors i'm using an automatic translator

Useful additions:

comments.text: Great project, having built several scopes the dob design is my favorite. I would like to help you with your views some, the contrast of your views will be greatly enhanced by blacking out overtaking in the light path. the inside of the mirror housing, the truss tubes and the inside of the secondary mirror housing. Also, with the mirror that close to the ground it will dew and get dirty very quickly with out a fabric shroud. A couple of yards of black spandex sewed and fitted over the scope will make a world of difference in the quality of the view.

comments.text: need parts list and suppliers. then make a black thick nylon shade to slip over and keep stray light out. there was a company in the 80s made a 6" telescopic pack version of this for a couple months. I own a 3" 1200mm FL 600 power Tasco I paid over $400 for in 74 which I used yesterday for eclipse. would love to have a larger objective lite weight easy stow scope for travel that dont take so much space and weight like 90 lbs plus use 2" eye pieces instead of just under 1" as those are obsolete to find now. still needs to be sturdy to support optics etc and not jiggle plus have clock drive optional hookup. getting close to the ultimate back pack scope here. only thing is Mirrors flake/fade every few years which can be disappointing if stored long between use. My Tasco only had the White paint on one side of projection screen flake off the past 45 years. everything else like new still plus I made silicone bead seal on case lid when new and keep descant in it to keep dry and store indoors climate controlled.

hour drive for Alt-azimuth mounts make it difficult for me ) but I'm working on it
comments.author: n2ri

comments.text: 1.25" is fine. at least still available at most suppliers. I have hard time finding anything for my old scope with just under an inch dia plus the high power ones are very tiny to look through. and impossible to use even at 600x as it was sold to do due to only 3" objective limits light too much for anything dimmer than the Sun and hard to track objects that close up manually lol. takes a while to learn limits and what type scope will fit your needs and budget. cheap scopes under a couple thousand are not for magnification over 400x at best and Solar system viewing only for view-able field. so Barlow multiplier also needs reconsidered as to worth buying and what power for eyepieces used. the Zoom is best option as you stated so no need for carrying extras or swapping mid viewing. Dobsobians are tricky to track with manually also making high power less likely to use well. but Sun (with filter on outside) and Moon viewing bright enough in 6-8 inch Mirror and digital camera use possible. I have used My refractor for all types of inner Solar system use at up to 400x but need clock drive for camera use when all settings are exact which takes time and practice. but I never regreted my purchase and shared use with many over the years. find a local Astronomy club if possible to fully enjoy the hobby and pass it on to your kids too.

description.text:
I needed more plants in my life but I don't live the kind of life that leads to much table top space (too messy).

The modular diamond wall pot allows you to hang your plants. Connect the multiple modules together to create your own wall design and then all you need to do is water the top diamond, which waters all of the remaining plants below. The final module ensures that no excess water is left on your wall. Only 1-2 nails are required to hang on the wall and only 3 different modules to create as many combinations as you want.

All junctions are between diamonds lock into place creating a strong and unique wall feature.

Just print, arrange, click, place and water. Simple.

print_settings.Notes:: PLA

description.text:
Lucky enough to play RPGs somewhere with a whiteboard? Want pieces to move without having to buy magnets in a appropriate of colors and sizes?

The RPG magnet is your answer. It can be used on both a magnetic surface and on a board, as the height of the stem makes the 'head' the appropriate height for a normal figure.

Get som 444 mm magnets (the strong kind) and print the RPG magnet in the colors you want!
It may also fit round magnets, up to 10 mm diameter, as long as they are not too thick for the stem to be screwed on securely and that the magnet can hold up about 7 grams while penetrating 0,75 mm plastic.

The basic is a base and stem. Put the magnet in the stem and screw it on the base; if it rattles, when you shake it, tighten it further!

The default print also come with two caps. The cap fits on top of the stem and makes it easy to change the 'identity' of a piece as well as which way it is facing.
Put a dymo-label with character names on the caps you usually use to make it easy to identify the pieces by both color and name.

Need to identify different monsters? Make some extra caps and use the 'dice stensil' to draw dice numbers on them.

Printer:

Sculpto

Rafts:

Yes

Supports:

No

Resolution:

Normal (0,25mm)

Infill:

Normal

Notes:

PLA

Background

We had used random magnets on a white board for a session of dungeons and dragons, but de did not have the right number and people couldn't remember which white magnet what who.

I had some 444 mm super magnets lying around (like you do - from failed experiments) and tried to find something I could print to use them as markers, but the magnets I was able to find all relied on glue to keep the magnet attached and with the extra strong and smooth magnets I had, this did not look like a viable option.

I went through a few versions, adjusting the length of the stem, the thickness of the base bottom and the fit of the cap.

comments.text: FYI: I am working on an updated version as we have had a problem with some of the pieces falling/sliding on the whiteboard. (Others are working just fine, may be the direction of the magnet)

author: myth777

description.text:
Add some rigidity to the Z axis, the lightweight way. Each bracket is around 15 grams.

Those are designed to go on top of the small integrated "L" corner pieces.

Required parts

For each side : 5 M4 allen screws the T-nuts, with 3 washers.

The right (motherboard) side has a slit to let you run the Y motor and endstop cables from the 2040 slot to the motherboard. If you don't need the slit, just can just mirror the left part, as they are otherwise identitcal.

Print with 30% infill, with a 6mm brim and zig-zag supports. Holes are large enough not to require drilling after print. A quick sanding of the bottom will remove any trace of the supports.

Installation :

  • Remove the supports with a screwdriver, than quickly sand the bottom of the bracket.
  • Insert a 4mm T-nut in the Z beam, and rotate it in place, against the metallic corner piece. I've done it with a screwdriver in the thread, and a toothpick to rotate it in the slit.
  • Fit the M4 screw with washers -except in the rounder corner- and the T-nuts to the bracket ("L" face and back qide)
  • Align the T-nuts with the pofile slots and push the bracket on the Tarantula, begin with the pair on the Z beam, then lower the bracket down to the bottom beam.
  • Tighten gently
  • Insert the last screw, in order to catch the T-nut that was previously put in the Z beam, and thighten it gently
  • Now make sure everything is closely pushed to the brackets, then tighten for good.
  • Repeat with the other side

After having installed those ones, the next step is here : https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:2497446

author: Steinsonn

title: Magnetic DS18B20 Sensor Mounting (concave or flat)

description.text:
As I want to use DS18B20 sensors to monitor the temperature through my heating system, I've made three mounts, that will position a DS18B20 sensor to a flat surface, a 15mm or 22m heating pipe.

In the baseplate, two magnets (3mm high, 5mm in diameter) are to be inserted, making the mounting stick to the pipes or radiators.

The magnets I used where bought at AliExpress
https://nl.aliexpress.com/item/50-pcs-N50-Super-Strong-Neodymium-Magnets-Rare-Earth-Mini-Round-Magnet-5mm-x-3mm/32764304190.html
